templates.description: This project deploys a LoRaWAN gateway with Basic™ Station Packet Forward protocol using docker.

env.label: MODEL
env.name: MODEL
env.description: The model is defined depending on either the version of the Semtech chip model: SX1301, SX1302 and SX1303, or concentrator modules, or RAK WisGate Development gateway model. Check Define your MODEL section on https://github.com/xoseperez/basicstation for more details.

env.label: Device
env.name: DEVICE
env.description: Where the concentrator is connected to

env.name: INTERFACE
env.label: Concentrator interface
env.description: The interface used by the concentrator, can be guessed from Device

env.label: Gateway RESET GPIO:
env.name: GW_RESET_GPIO:
env.description: GPIO number that resets (Broadcom pin number)

env.label: Gateway ENABLE GPIO
env.name: GW_ENABLE_GPIO
env.description: GPIO number that enables power (by pulling HIGH) to the concentrator (Broadcom pin number)

env.label: GATEWAY EUI NIC
env.name: GATEWAY_EUI_NIC
env.description: Interface to use when generating the EUI

env.label: GATEWAY EUI
env.name: GATEWAYEUI
env.description: Gateway EUI to use, autogenerated from GATEWAY EUI NIC if defined, otherwise in order from: eth0, wlan0, usb0

env.label: TTN REGION
env.name: TTN_REGION
env.description: Region of the TTN server to use, possible values: eu1, nam1, au1

env.default: change this to your own TC key from TTN
env.label: TC KEY
env.name: TC_KEY
env.description: Unique TTN Gateway Key used for TTS Community Edition pasted from TTN console

templates.name: BasicStation_Packet_Forwarder
templates.title: BasicStation Packet Forwarder

templates.description: Node-RED is a flow-based development tool for visual programming.
templates.name: NodeRed
templates.title: NodeRed

templates.description: The ChirpStack open-source LoRaWAN Network Server stack provides open-source components for LoRaWAN networks.

env.label: Network Server Band
env.name: NETWORK_SERVER__BAND__NAME
env.description: Frequency channels used by Chirpstack for uplink transmissions, valid values are AU915, EU868, US915 ...

templates.name: ChirpStack_Network_Server
templates.title: ChirpStack Network Server

templates.description: The Things Stack LNS establishes a data connection between a LoRa Basics™ Station gateway and a Network Server (in this case, The Things Stack).

env.label: TTS DOMAIN
env.name: TTS_DOMAIN
env.description: set this to the IP or domain name of the host you will be using to access the stack

templates.name: The Things Stack LNS
templates.title: The Things Stack LNS

templates.description: Dockerize the rak_common_for_gateway project, which aim to help users to use the RAK Raspberry Pi Developer Gateway more easily.

env.name: MODEL
env.label: RAK gateway model
env.description: RAKwireless Developer gateway model. Once defined, we take care of all the concentrator configurations and you can skip to option <Interface for gateway EUI>

env.name: MODEL
env.label: RAK WisLink LPWAN module
env.description: If RAK gateway model is not defined, you can define either <RAKwireless WisLink LPWAN module> or <Semtech concentrator>. Once defined this virable, also need to specify other features of the module, for example, <Concentrator interface>,<HAS GPS>,<HAS LTE>.

env.name: CONCENTRATOR
env.label: Semtech concentrator
env.description: If RAK gateway model is not defined, you can define either <Semtech concentrator> or <RAKwireless WisLink LPWAN module>. Once defined this virable, also need to specify other features of the module, for example, <Concentrator interface>,<HAS GPS>,<HAS LTE>.

env.name: INTERFACE
env.label: Concentrator interface
env.description: If MODEL is defined it will get the interface type from it, otherwise defaults to SPI

env.name: HAS_GPS
env.label: Has GPS
env.description: If MODEL is defined it will get this from it, otherwise defaults to 1 (with GPS)

env.name: HAS_LTE
env.label: Has LTE
env.description: If MODEL id defined it will get this from it, otherwise defaults to 0 (without LTE)

env.name: RESET_GPIO
env.label: GATEWAY RESET GPIO
env.description: GPIO number that resets (Broadcom pin number)

env.name: POWER_EN_GPIO
env.label: the GPIO enables power
env.description: GPIO number that enables power (by pulling HIGH) to the concentrator (Broadcom pin number). 0 means not required

env.name: RADIO_DEV
env.default: Don't set it if you don't know what this means
env.label: Where the concentrator is connected to
env.description: /dev/spidev0.0 for SPI concentrators, /dev/ttyACM0 for USB concentrators.

env.name: GPS_DEV
env.default: Don't set it if you don't know what this means
env.label: Where the GPS is connected to
env.description: /dev/ttyAMA0 except when HAS_LTE is 1, in this case it will default to /dev/i2c-1.

env.name: GATEWAY_EUI_NIC
env.label: Interface for gateway EUI
env.description: Interface to use when generating the EUI, default to eth0

env.name: GATEWAY_EUI
env.label: Gateway EUI
env.description: Autogenerated from GATEWAY_EUI_NIC if defined, otherwise in order from: eth0, wlan0, usb0

env.name: TTN_REGION
env.label: TTN region
env.description: If using a TTN server, region of the TTN server to use. Can be eu1, nam1, and au1

env.name: SERVER_HOST
env.label: Host Server URL
env.description: If TTN_REGION is defined it will build the right address for the TTN server

env.name: SERVER_PORT
env.label: Server port
env.description: Port the server is listening to

env.name: BAND
env.label: TTN Frequency Plan
env.description: Regional parameters identifier

env.name: GPS_LATITUDE
env.label: GPS LATITUDE
env.description: Report this latitude for the gateway

env.name: GPS_LONGITUDE
env.label: GPS LONGITUDE
env.description: Report this longitude for the gateway

env.name: GPS_ALTITUDE
env.label: GPS ALTITUDE
env.description: Report this altitude for the gateway

templates.name: UDP_Packet_Forwarder
templates.title: UDP Packet Forwarder

templates.description: Eclipse Mosquitto is an open source implementation of a server for versions 5, 3.1.1, and 3.1 of the MQTT protocol.
templates.name: Eclipse-Mosquitto
templates.title: Eclipse Mosquitto

templates.description: Grafana is a multi-platform open source analytics and interactive visualization web application.

env.label: Grafana plugins
env.name: GF_INSTALL_PLUGINS
env.description: Pass the plugins you want installed to Docker with the GF_INSTALL_PLUGINS environment variable as a comma-separated list.

templates.name: grafana
templates.title: Grafana

templates.description: InfluxDB is a time series database built from the ground up to handle high write and query loads.

env.name: DOCKER_INFLUXDB_INIT_MODE
env.label: Influx initial mode
env.description: Set DOCKER_INFLUXDB_INIT_MODE to setup enables the InfluxDB image to automatically bootstrap the system.

env.name: DOCKER_INFLUXDB_INIT_USERNAME
env.label: Influx initial username
env.description: The username to set for the system's initial super-user (Required).

env.name: DOCKER_INFLUXDB_INIT_PASSWORD
env.label: Influx initial password
env.description: The password to set for the system's inital super-user (Required).

env.name: DOCKER_INFLUXDB_INIT_ORG
env.label: Influx initial organization
env.description: The name to set for the system's initial organization (Required).

env.name: DOCKER_INFLUXDB_INIT_BUCKET
env.label: Influx initial bucket
env.description: The name to set for the system's initial bucket (Required).

env.name: DOCKER_INFLUXDB_INIT_RETENTION
env.label: Influx initial bucket retain data duration
env.description: Optional. E.g. 1w means tetain te data for 1 week. If not set, the initial bucket will retain data forever.

env.name: DOCKER_INFLUXDB_INIT_ADMIN_TOKEN
env.label: initial super-user's authentication token to associate with the system's
env.description: Optional. The authentication token to associate with the system's initial super-user. If not set, a token will be auto-generated by the system.

templates.name: influxdb
templates.title: InfluxDB

templates.description: ThingsBoard allows you to create rich IoT Dashboards for data visualization and remote device control in real-time

env.name: TB_QUEUE_TYPE
env.label: ThingsBoard queue service
env.description: ThingsBoard uses various messaging systems/brokers for storing the messages and communication between ThingsBoard services. Check https://thingsboard.io/docs/user-guide/install/docker/?ubuntuThingsboardQueue=inmemory for more details

templates.name: thingsBoard
templates.title: Thingsboard

templates.description: TimescaleDB is a an open-source time-series database optimized for fast ingest and complex queries.

env.name: POSTGRES_PASSWORD
env.label: Influx initial mode
env.description: Set DOCKER_INFLUXDB_INIT_MODE to setup enables the InfluxDB image to automatically bootstrap the system.

env.name: TIMESCALEDB_TELEMETRY
env.label: TimescaleDB telemetry
env.description: Set TimescaleDB telemetry to off to turn off telemetry, only works for if the cluster has not been initialized previously

env.name: timescaledb-tune
env.label: TimescaleDB max number of connections
env.description: Limiting the amount of resources the container can have on the host. If select ture, please update the following timescaledb-tune virables.

env.name: TS_TUNE_MEMORY
env.label: TimescaleDB memory limitation
env.description: Optional. E.g. 2GB.

env.name: TS_TUNE_NUM_CPUS
env.label: TimescaleDB CPUs
env.description: Optional. E.g. 4.

env.name: TS_TUNE_MAX_BG_WORKERS
env.label: TimescaleDB max background workers
env.description: Optional. Specifize a maximum number of background workers.

env.name: TS_TUNE_MAX_CONNS
env.label: TimescaleDB max number of connections
env.description: Optional. Specifize a maximum number of connections.

templates.name: timescaleDB
templates.title: TimescaleDB
